metadata.purpose: User testing personas for TallyUps app

personas.name: Marcus Chen
pain_points: No time to organize expenses during busy lunch rush
Cash transactions are hard to track
goals: Quickly snap receipt photos between customers
Separate food costs from equipment expenses
personas.scenario: Marcus runs a popular Korean BBQ food truck. He buys ingredients at 5am, serves lunch crowds, and is exhausted by evening. He needs an app that works fast and doesn't require perfect receipt photos.

personas.name: Dr. Amara Okonkwo
pain_points: Multiple expense categories (supplies, equipment, CE courses)
goals: Delegate receipt capture to office manager
personas.scenario: Dr. Okonkwo runs a 5-chair dental practice with 8 employees. She needs to track everything from dental supplies to continuing education. Her office manager handles day-to-day expenses but she approves large purchases.
personas.financial_complexity: High - business expenses, payroll, equipment depreciation

personas.name: Tyler Rodriguez
pain_points: Two very different income streams to track
Subscription costs add up (Adobe, Figma, etc.)
goals: Separate design business from delivery gig
personas.scenario: Tyler designs logos and brand identities while driving DoorDash during slow periods. They need to track design software subscriptions, home office expenses, AND delivery-related costs like gas and car maintenance.

personas.name: Barbara 'Barb' Wellington
personas.occupation: Retired CFO, Now Real Estate Investor
pain_points: Small text is hard to read
personas.scenario: Barb owns 12 rental properties across 3 states. She's highly financially literate but struggles with modern app interfaces. She needs clear, simple design with the ability to export detailed reports.
personas.financial_complexity: Very High - multiple properties, depreciation, 1031 exchanges

personas.name: Jamal Washington
pain_points: Constant travel means hundreds of receipts monthly
Need to match receipts to client meetings
Per diem vs actual expense tracking
personas.scenario: Jamal visits 15-20 doctors' offices per week across the Midwest. He takes clients to dinner, stays in hotels, and racks up rental car expenses. His company reimburses but requires detailed documentation.

personas.name: Priya Sharma
pain_points: Concerned about where receipt data is stored
Wants API access for custom integrations
Frustrated by apps that don't respect privacy
Needs to separate side consulting from W-2 job
personas.scenario: Priya manages a team at a major tech company but also does weekend consulting. She's extremely privacy-conscious and will scrutinize data handling practices. She might even try to hack the app to test security.

personas.name: Miguel Santos
pain_points: Phone gets dusty and dirty on job sites
Receipts from hardware stores fade quickly
Wife does the books - needs to share access
goals: Share data with wife for bookkeeping
personas.scenario: Miguel runs a 3-person construction crew. He buys materials at Home Depot, Lowe's, and specialty suppliers. His wife Maria does the bookkeeping at night. He needs something rugged and simple.

personas.name: Emma Lindqvist
pain_points: Need to prove business purpose of travel
personas.scenario: Emma travels 200+ days per year, often internationally. She needs to track hotel stays, flights, meals, and equipment that are legitimately business expenses for her content creation business.
personas.financial_complexity: High - international, multiple income streams, equipment depreciation

personas.name: David Kim
pain_points: Mileage tracking is everything for taxes
personas.scenario: David drives 10-12 hours daily, 6 days a week. He fills up gas 3-4 times per week, gets oil changes monthly, and replaces tires frequently. Every deductible mile matters for his tax situation.
personas.financial_complexity: Medium - vehicle expenses, mileage deduction, quarterly taxes

personas.name: Jennifer 'Jen' O'Brien
pain_points: Must separate personal from org expenses
personas.scenario: Jen runs a youth education non-profit with a $2M budget across 5 different grants. Each grant has specific expense requirements. She needs to prove every dollar is spent appropriately.
personas.financial_complexity: High - restricted funds, grant compliance, audit requirements

personas.name: Alex Rivera
pain_points: Craft supplies come from dozens of sources
Need to calculate true cost per item
Craft fair booth fees and travel
goals: Track cost of goods sold accurately
personas.scenario: Alex makes handmade jewelry and sells on Etsy plus 10-15 craft fairs annually. He buys supplies from Amazon, Michaels, specialty bead shops, and salvage stores. He needs to know his true profit margin.

personas.name: Susan 'Sue' Kowalski
pain_points: Currently uses shoebox method for receipts
Tax accountant begs her to organize
personas.scenario: Sue has been in insurance for 30 years and uses paper for everything. Her accountant and daughter have both urged her to go digital. She's finally willing to try but needs serious hand-holding.
personas.financial_complexity: Medium - commission tracking, client entertainment, home office

personas.name: Jordan Thompson
pain_points: Learning to budget for the first time
Parents want to see his spending
goals: Learn business expense tracking for future
personas.scenario: Jordan's parents offered to match his savings if he tracks expenses responsibly. He's motivated but has never done this before. He's learning personal finance AND considering starting a tutoring side business.

personas.name: Hiroshi Tanaka
pain_points: Employees make purchases on his behalf
goals: Allow trusted employees to submit receipts
personas.scenario: Hiroshi owns three Japanese restaurants. Each has a manager who makes purchases. He needs to track everything but can't be everywhere. He's traditional but knows he needs better systems to scale.
personas.financial_complexity: Very High - multiple entities, inventory, employees

personas.name: Rachel Green-Foster
pain_points: Travel to venues across the state
goals: Manage cash flow across slow seasons
personas.scenario: Rachel shoots 25-30 weddings per year, mostly between May-October. She spends $15K+ on equipment annually and travels extensively. Off-season is for editing, marketing, and financial planning.
personas.financial_complexity: High - seasonal income, equipment depreciation, contractors

personas.name: William 'Bill' Patterson
pain_points: Apps assume too much tech knowledge
Small screens are hard to use
goals: Simple expense tracking for tax prep business
personas.scenario: Bill was a CPA for 40 years and now does tax prep part-time for seniors. He struggles with modern apps but wants to stay current. If he can use TallyUps, he'll recommend it to clients.

personas.name: Fatima Al-Hassan
pain_points: Family members help but track inconsistently
personas.scenario: Fatima runs a specialty grocery store importing Mediterranean foods. Receipts come in English, Arabic, and Turkish. She juggles import documentation, local suppliers, and a rotating cast of family helpers.

personas.name: Connor Murphy
pain_points: Income from 5+ sources (gigs, lessons, streaming, merch)
Needs to track mileage to gigs and lessons
personas.scenario: Connor plays in two bands, teaches 20 private students weekly, sells merch, and gets tiny streaming royalties. His finances are a mess. He knows he's leaving money on the table at tax time.

personas.name: Dr. Sarah Chen-Williams
goals: Track expenses by vehicle vs clinical
personas.scenario: Sarah runs a mobile vet practice, driving her specially-equipped van to homes across Portland. She buys supplies at multiple locations, tracks controlled substance purchases carefully, and logs significant miles.
personas.financial_complexity: High - mobile business, vehicle, inventory, compliance

personas.name: Kevin O'Malley
pain_points: Constant travel means daily expense reports
personas.scenario: Kevin travels 4 days a week to client sites. His firm requires detailed expense reporting with receipts for everything over $25. He's frustrated by manual processes and wants automation.

personas.name: Maria Gonzalez
personas.scenario: Maria started cleaning houses 15 years ago and now has 3 employees and 40 regular clients. She wants to grow but needs better financial records. Spanish is her first language.

personas.name: Brian 'BK' Kowalski
pain_points: Needs to track by customer vehicle
Wife handles books but needs his receipts
goals: Stop losing receipts in the shop
personas.scenario: BK's shop does 15-20 jobs per week. He orders parts from multiple suppliers, often on the spot. His hands are dirty, phone screen is cracked, but he needs to capture receipts somehow.
personas.financial_complexity: Medium - parts inventory, labor, customer jobs

personas.name: Aisha Johnson
personas.scenario: Aisha is a rising star at her brokerage, closing 25 deals last year. She spends heavily on marketing, client gifts, and driving to showings. She needs to track it all for tax purposes.

personas.name: Robert 'Rob' Anderson
pain_points: Team of 8 reps who all submit expenses
Need to approve before company reimbursement
personas.scenario: Rob manages 8 sales reps across 5 states. He needs to approve their expenses before submitting to corporate. Currently it's a mess of emails and spreadsheets.

personas.name: Dr. James 'Jimmy' Patel
pain_points: CME courses and conferences are expensive
Locum tenens work requires travel tracking
personas.scenario: Jimmy works ER shifts plus occasional locum tenens assignments. He attends 2-3 medical conferences per year. He has money but no time, and wants the app to do everything automatically.
personas.financial_complexity: High - W-2 + 1099, CME, licensing, possible S-corp

personas.name: Lisa Chang
pain_points: Will judge the app's UX harshly
Needs to track personal vs work expenses on same device
personas.scenario: Lisa is a senior UX designer working remotely. She's spent thousands on her home office setup. She'll be very critical of any UX issues in the app.
personas.financial_complexity: Medium - W-2, home office, professional development

personas.name: Thomas 'Tom' Wright
goals: Track fuel and maintenance per charter
Plan for winter maintenance during summer
personas.scenario: Tom runs fishing and sunset charters 8 months a year. Fuel costs $500+ per trip. He does constant boat maintenance. Phone often gets splashed or used with wet hands.
personas.financial_complexity: High - vessel expenses, fuel, maintenance, seasonality

personas.name: Stephanie Brooks
pain_points: Need to track against event budget
personas.scenario: Stephanie plans 30-40 events per year, from weddings to corporate events. She juggles multiple vendors, strict client budgets, and needs to track every dollar spent per event.
personas.financial_complexity: High - project-based, client billing, vendor management

personas.name: Derek 'DJ D' Williams
pain_points: Works nights - expenses happen at odd hours
personas.scenario: DJ D works clubs, weddings, and corporate events. He's spent $50K on equipment over 5 years. He needs to track licensing fees, transportation, and promotional expenses.
personas.financial_complexity: Medium-High - equipment depreciation, licensing, variable income

personas.name: Patricia 'Patty' Nelson
personas.scenario: Patty runs a licensed daycare with 35 children and 6 staff. She has strict documentation requirements for licensing. Food, supplies, and training expenses must be meticulously tracked.

personas.name: Andre Dubois
personas.scenario: Andre consults for 8-10 restaurants annually, helping them develop menus and train staff. He travels extensively, tests equipment, and develops recipes. Each client is a separate project.

personas.name: Michelle 'Micki' Torres
personas.scenario: Micki is a sought-after tattoo artist who rents a chair at a studio. She attends 4-5 conventions per year and buys specialty supplies online. Cash is still common in her industry.

personas.name: Victor Okonkwo
goals: Track by client project for billing
personas.scenario: Victor runs a growing IT consulting firm. He needs expense tracking that scales across 12 employees, tracks by client project, and integrates with his accounting stack.
personas.financial_complexity: Very High - employees, projects, international, integration

personas.name: Nancy Liu
personas.scenario: Nancy runs a private acupuncture practice and stocks hundreds of Chinese herbs. She has significant inventory costs, continuing education requirements, and needs to track supplies carefully.

personas.name: Ryan O'Connor
personas.scenario: Ryan trains 20 clients per week and creates fitness content for 150K followers. He receives sponsored products, pays gym rental, and invests in camera equipment. Income comes from multiple sources.
personas.financial_complexity: High - sponsorships, multiple income, content creation

personas.name: Catherine 'Cat' Morrison
personas.scenario: Cat runs a high-end interior design firm with 5-8 major projects per year. She purchases materials on trade accounts, tracks samples, and needs to bill clients accurately for purchases.
personas.financial_complexity: High - project billing, trade accounts, client pass-through

personas.name: Samuel 'Sam' Nakamura
pain_points: Wants to know cost per drink
personas.scenario: Sam owns a specialty coffee shop focused on quality. His beans cost 3x normal, equipment needs regular maintenance, and he wants to understand if his $6 lattes are actually profitable.

personas.name: Danielle Foster
personas.scenario: Danielle lobbies for 5 corporate clients on energy policy. She entertains legislators, travels to state capitals, and needs meticulous documentation while maintaining client confidentiality.

personas.name: Oscar Hernandez
pain_points: Crew of 8 needs to track supplies
personas.scenario: Oscar runs a landscaping company with 8 crew members and 15 commercial properties. His guys buy supplies, fuel up trucks, and he needs to track it all by property for billing.

personas.name: Grace Kim-Peterson
personas.scenario: Grace owns a yoga studio and leads 2-3 international retreats per year. Studio rent, props, training, and retreat costs all need tracking. She values simple, mindful processes.

personas.name: Michael 'Mike' Brennan
personas.scenario: Mike has been an electrician for 25 years and runs his own shop. He's old school but knows he needs to modernize. His wife helps with books but needs his receipts to be organized.

personas.name: Aaliyah Jackson
personas.scenario: Aaliyah is grinding as an aspiring actress, working a day job while paying for classes, headshots, and driving all over LA for auditions. She needs to track expenses now for when she makes it big.

personas.name: Dr. Richard 'Rick' Yamamoto
pain_points: Travel to DoD and VA facilities
Security clearance requires care with data
personas.scenario: Rick retired as a Colonel and now consults for DoD healthcare programs. He travels to military facilities, has strict documentation requirements, and is careful about data security.

personas.name: Heather Collins
personas.scenario: Heather runs a design agency with 4 employees and regular freelancers. Projects need expense tracking, software costs are significant, and freelancer invoices need documentation.

personas.name: Jerome 'Jerry' Washington
goals: Track fuel and maintenance by trip
personas.scenario: Jerry owns his rig and drives cross-country. He's away from home 3 weeks at a time, fueling up at truck stops, getting repairs on the road, and tracking per diem meals.
personas.financial_complexity: High - truck ownership, fuel, maintenance, per diem

personas.name: Natalie Rosenberg
personas.scenario: Natalie raised Series A and now has 15 employees. Her investors want expense visibility, she needs to control burn rate, and she needs real-time data for board meetings.
personas.financial_complexity: Very High - startup, team, investor reporting, burn rate

personas.name: Frank 'Frankie' Moretti
pain_points: Wants to recommend tools to clients
personas.scenario: Frankie does taxes for extended family and friends. He's evaluating TallyUps personally but will recommend it to clients if it works well. He'll test OCR accuracy rigorously.
personas.financial_complexity: Medium - evaluating for multiple use cases

personas.name: Jasmine Parker
pain_points: Mixes personal and work on same phone
personas.scenario: Jasmine manages social media for agency clients. She takes clients to lunch, attends conferences, and uses various paid tools. She needs to submit clean expense reports to get reimbursed.

personas.name: Alexei Volkov
personas.scenario: Alexei imports specialty goods from Eastern Europe. He deals with receipts in Russian, Ukrainian, and Polish. Customs fees, international shipping, and currency conversion are daily challenges.

personas.name: Maya Patel-Johnson
personas.scenario: Maya left corporate accounting to raise kids and now does bookkeeping for 6 small businesses part-time. She wishes her clients would use proper expense tracking. She might recommend TallyUps to them.
personas.financial_complexity: High - multiple client businesses, professional use
